title: Chaos, Naked Cowboy And Abuse: Donald Trump Spectacle Snarls New York
content: New York is where Trump made his name as a playboy property developer, emblazoning skyscrapers with his name and searing himself into popular culture through media appearances and stunts well before he ran for office.
summary: New York is where Trump made his name as a playboy property developer, emblazoning skyscrapers with his name and searing himself into popular culture through media appearances and stunts well before he ran for office.

title: Down To The Wire: Donald Trump, Kamala Harris In Final Week Push

title: Record Number Of Women Win Seats In Japan Election But Still A Minority
content: A record number of women have been elected to Japan's house of representatives, projections showed Monday, but at less than 16 percent they remain a minority.

title: President Biden To Celebrate Diwali With Indian Americans At White House

title: Donald Trump's New York Rally Attacks Kamala Harris, Draws Criticism

title: After Disastrous Election, What Happens To Japan's New Prime Minister?
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's ruling coalition fell short of his declared "victory line" of a majority in snap parliamentary elections, media projections showed Monday.

title: Kamala Harris: Can Underestimated Trailblazer Beat Trump?
content: Within a few short weeks, Kamala Harris created an election campaign out of nothing. She held rapturous rallies, raised more than $1 billion in funds and brought what she called a burst of joy to a party that had given up hope.

title: Gerard Depardieu, Titan Of French Cinema Faces Trial

title: Israel To Face "Bitter Consequences", Says Iran Guards Chief After Attack

title: Trump's Rally Features Crude, Racial Insults; Venue Once Saw Pro-Nazi Rally

title: Iraq Complains UN Over Israel Using Its Airspace To Attack Iran
content: Iraq has condemned Israel's use of its airspace to attack neighbouring Iran in a protest letter sent to United Nations chief Antonio Guterres and the UN Security Council, Baghdad said Monday.
